messages.content: ComfyUI-RGT is a custom node in ComfyUI that implements the Recursive Generalization Transformer for Image Super-Resolution.
What is the original paper and GitHub link for RGT?
The original paper for RGT can be found at https://arxiv.org/abs/2303.06373 and the GitHub link is https://github.com/zhengchen1999/RGT.

To install ComfyUI-RGT, navigate to the custom_nodes directory in your ComfyUI installation and run 'git clone https://github.com/viperyl/ComfyUI-RGT.git'. Then, navigate into the cloned directory and run 'pip install -r requirements.txt'.
Where can I download the model for ComfyUI-RGT?
The model for ComfyUI-RGT can be downloaded from the Hugging Face repository at https://huggingface.co/ViperYX/RGT. Clone this repository into the models directory of your ComfyUI installation.
Is there an example workflow available for ComfyUI-RGT?
Yes, there is an example workflow available in the 'workflow' folder of the ComfyUI-RGT installation.
What are the available model types in ComfyUI-RGT?
ComfyUI-RGT offers two model types: RGT and RGT-S. The RGT model is usually better than the RGT-S model.
What upscale options are available in ComfyUI-RGT?
ComfyUI-RGT provides x2, x3, and x4 upscale options.
Does ComfyUI-RGT support tiled processing of images to save VRAM?
Yes, ComfyUI-RGT allows processing images with tiled operation using the 'use_chop' parameter, which can save VRAM.
